name: CKEDITOR.dialog.definition.radio
doc:
The definition of a radio group.

This class is not really part of the API. It just illustrates the properties that developers can use to define and create groups of radio buttons.

Once the dialog is opened, the created element becomes a CKEDITOR.ui.dialog.radio object and can be accessed with CKEDITOR.dialog.getContentElement.

For a complete example of dialog definition, please check CKEDITOR.dialog.add.

// There is no constructor for this class, the user just has to define an
// object with the appropriate properties.

// Example:
{
    type: 'radio',
    id: 'country',
    label: 'Which country is bigger',
    items: [ [ 'France', 'FR' ], [ 'Germany', 'DE' ] ],
    style: 'color: green',
    'default': 'DE',
    onClick: function() {
        // this = CKEDITOR.ui.dialog.radio
        alert( 'Current value: ' + this.getValue() );
    }
}

members.name: align
members.doc: Horizontal alignment (in container) of the UI element.

members.name: className
members.doc: CSS class names to append to the UI element.

members.name: commit
members.doc: Function to execute whenever the UI element's parent dialog's CKEDITOR.dialog.commitContent method is executed. It usually takes care of the respective UI element as a standalone element.
members.short_doc:
Function to execute whenever the UI element's parent
dialog's CKEDITOR.dialog.commitContent method is executed. ...

members.name: controlStyle
members.doc:
Specify the inline style of the input element container.

{
    type: 'text',
    label: 'My Label',
    controlStyle: 'width: 3em'
}
members.short_doc: Specify the inline style of the input element container. ...

members.name: default
members.doc: The default value.

members.name: id
members.doc: The id of the UI element.

members.name: inputStyle
members.doc:
Specify the inline style of the input element.

{
    type: 'text',
    label: 'My Label',
    inputStyle: 'text-align: center'
}
members.short_doc: Specify the inline style of the input element. ...

members.name: items
members.doc: An array of options. Each option is a 1- or 2-item array of format [ 'Description', 'Value' ]. If 'Value' is missing, then the value would be assumed to be the same as the description.

members.name: label
members.doc:
The label of the UI element.

{
    type: 'text',
    label: 'My Label'
}
members.short_doc: The label of the UI element. ...

members.name: labelLayout
members.doc:
(Optional) Specify the layout of the label. Set to 'horizontal' for horizontal layout. The default layout is vertical.

{
    type: 'text',
    label: 'My Label',
    labelLayout: 'horizontal'
}
members.short_doc: (Optional) Specify the layout of the label. ...

members.name: labelStyle
members.doc:
Specify the inline style of the uiElement label.

{
    type: 'text',
    label: 'My Label',
    labelStyle: 'color: red'
}
members.short_doc: Specify the inline style of the uiElement label. ...

members.name: onHide
members.doc: Function to execute whenever the UI element's parent dialog is closed.

members.name: onLoad
members.doc: Function to execute the first time the UI element is displayed.

members.name: onShow
members.doc: Function to execute whenever the UI element's parent dialog is displayed.

members.name: requiredContent
members.doc:
The content that needs to be allowed to enable this UI element. All formats accepted by CKEDITOR.filter.check may be used.

When all UI elements in a tab are disabled, this tab will be disabled automatically.
members.short_doc: The content that needs to be allowed to enable this UI element. ...

members.name: setup
members.doc: Function to execute whenever the UI element's parent dialog's CKEDITOR.dialog.setupContent method is executed. It usually takes care of the respective UI element as a standalone element.
members.short_doc:
Function to execute whenever the UI element's parent
dialog's CKEDITOR.dialog.setupContent method is executed. ...

members.name: style
members.doc: Inline CSS classes to append to the UI element.

members.name: title
members.doc: The popup label of the UI element.

members.name: type
members.doc: The type of the UI element. Required.
members.short_doc: The type of the UI element. ...

members.name: validate
members.doc: (Optional) The validation function.

members.name: widths
members.doc:
(Optional) Applies only to horizontal layouts: a two elements array of lengths to specify the widths of the label and the content element. See also labelLayout.

{
    type: 'text',
    label: 'My Label',
    labelLayout: 'horizontal',
    widths: [100, 200]
}
members.short_doc:
(Optional) Applies only to horizontal layouts: a two elements array of lengths to specify the widths of the
label and...

short_doc: The definition of a radio group. ...
